header.abstract: The Evelyn Knight "digitizeManipur" Records (dated 1980-2008, undated; .45 cubic feet; 1 document box) comprise magazines, programs, brochures and pamphlets, newspapers, articles, and books documenting the University of Kentucky Appalachian Center and UK Libraries participation in an international consortium efforts to fund a "digitizeManipur" project, part of the British Library's International Dunhuang Project.

descriptive_summary.author: Ruth E. Bryan
descriptive_summary.title: Evelyn Knight "digitizeManipur" Records
descriptive_summary.creator: Knight, Evelyn A.
descriptive_summary.arrangement: Collection retains its original order. Where possible original folder names were retained.
descriptive_summary.prefercite: 2024ua052 : [identification of item], Evelyn Knight "digitizeManipur" Records, 1980-2008, undated, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: L. Somi Roy founded digitizeManipur following the arson and destruction of books in the Central Library of Manipur, a state in northeast Indai, in April 2005. Many of the texts destroyed were in the native Manipuri Tibeto-Burman language and script variously transliterated as Meitei, Meytei, Meetie Mayek, or Meitei-lon. Roy proposed the digitization of the next largest collection of Manipuri manuscripts in the private collection of Oja N. Khelchandra. The digitized texts would be held by the New York Public Library. Much of the current language in Manipur is Bengali, dating from the 18th century. Following a research seminar held at the University of Kentucky (Mapping a Mountain Path to Top-20 Scholarship) in 2006 that included Roy, other Manipuri artists and filmmakers, and UK and other American scholars, a project team from the University of Kentucky visited Manipur in April 2008. This collection of printed material was gathered by Evelyn Knight, Director of the Univertisty of Kentucky Appalachian Center and digitizeManipur project member, mainly during that 2008 trip.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Evelyn Knight "digitizeManipur" Records (dated 1980-2008, undated; .45 cubic feet; 1 document box) comprise magazines, programs, brochures and pamphlets, newspapers, articles, and books documenting the University of Kentucky Appalachian Center and UK Libraries participation in an international consortium efforts to fund a "digitizeManipur" project, part of the British Library's International Dunhuang Project. Many of the items in the collection are in the native Manipuri Tibeto-Burman language and script variously transliterated as Meitei, Meytei, Meetie Mayek, or Meitei-lon.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the University of Kentucky. The University of Kentucky holds the copyright for materials created in the course of business by University of Kentucky employees. Copyright for all other materials has not been assigned to the University of Kentucky. For information about permission to reproduce or publish, please contact the Special Collections Research Center.

did.unittitle: Manipur Today: Khongjom Day special issue (for Day of Mourning), Department of Public Relations, Government of Manipur
digitizeManipur project documents and clippings and program for UK event, Mapping a Mountain Path to Top-20 Scholarship
Manipur Polo article (photocopy) by N. Tombi Raj; souvenir magazine for the National and International Tent Pegging Championships, Imphal-Manipur
Art from India exhibit at UK Art Museum (did not include Northeast India/Manipur)
Public Folklore, Nation-Building, and Regional Others: Comparing Appalachian USA and North-East India, by Betsy Taylor (adjunct faculty in the Appalachian Center) (photocopied article)

A Colloquium on International Digital Preservation and Conservation and Scholarship in Manipur: An Exploration of an International Learning Community: On the occasion of the Research Trip for DigitizeManipur brochure and conference information, Manipur University
Newspaper articles and opinion pieces about Meetei Mayek, including about computerizing the language script/symbols

Government of Manipur, Secretariat of the Education Department, order regarding reintroduction of Meitei/Meetei scripts (includes alphabet and a crosswalk of letters to another, unidentified, language) (photocopy)
Exhibit catalog, Exhibition on Old Scriptures and Manuscripts in the Private Repository of Padmashri N. Khelchandra Singh, Uripok, Imphal, Manipur (photocopy)
Imphal, Manipur, newspaper issue featuring photograph of Becky Ryder and Mary Molinaro from UK Libraries on front page, top and center
Souvenir program, Silver Jubilee Celebration of People's Museum, in Collaboration with Directorate of Arts and Culture, Government of Manipur
Brochure, National Workshop on Preservation of Rare Documents (Physical, Chemical, and Digital), National Library Kolkata, Ministry of Culture, Goverment of India
Book, Chainarol (The Way of the Warrior), transcribed and rendered into modern Manipuri by Chanam Hemchandra, published by Lamyanba Publishers, Konung Lampak
Book, Numit Kaappa (Of Kings and a Rebel), transcribed and rendered into modern Manipuri by Chanam Hemchandra, published by Lamyanba Publishers, Konung Lampak
Meytei vocabulary materials and teaching aids, with translations/transliterations (including Anand Longjam's Meitie Roman Laiyekki Longei)
Meytei vocabulary materials and teaching aids, without translations/transliterations
Tourist and general knowledge printed material about Manipur
L. Somi Roy information folder (includes Appalachia to Southwest China filmmakers' exchange and First Pitch: the US Manipur Baseball Project)
